name: REFERENCE / METHOD - G22 Cl 3.4 G36 G38
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure SWMS & EWMS are in place, understood and signed off by all personnel involved in completing the task
○ Ensure EPL criteria are conformed with
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure ERSED plan has been developed and communicated to site team.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Traffic control is in place.
○ Relevant TCP and VMP are approved
1.4 - Construction Lot Identification, Traceability and Frequency of Testing
REFERENCE / METHOD - Q6, Cl 7.5.3 Annexure L1 Annexure L3
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Set the bounds for each construction lot as per Q6 requirements
○ This Lot Number as an identifier on all quality records
○ Lot map is prepared for traceability
○ Frequency of testing as per Q6/L3 and specification requirements
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Concrete properties and delivery, placing, compaction, finishing, curing and protection in accordance with RMS R53.
2.2 - Production of Concrete Mix HOLD POINT
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Submit any one of the following:
(a) The documents specified in Clause 2.4.3 items (a) and (b); or
(b) Details of mix(es) selected from the RMS Register of Concrete Mixes, together with a statement certifying that the mix conforms to this Specification and is suitable for its intended use
FREQUENCY - At least 5 days prior to production
RECORD / COMMENTS - HP Release / Refer to checklist 1680- CHK-R15-001
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - The curing compound must be:
(a) a hydrocarbon resin compound complying with AS 3799 Class B, Type 1-D; or
(b) a wax emulsion complying with AS 3799 Class A, Type 1-D.
RECORD / COMMENTS - CoC / Refer to checklist 1680- CHK-R15-001
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Do not undercut the batters of cuttings. Construct kerbs and gutters in accordance with AS 2876 modified as shown in Table R15.1.
○ Provide a steel float finish to gutter inverts and faces of kerbs (unless otherwise in Drawings).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - As nominated on Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Compact subgrade, subbase and base layers supporting kerb and gutter to standard specified for the adjacent pavement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Gutter and adjacent pavement gutter lip +0/-10 mm to adjoining pavement surface.
RECORD / COMMENTS - Survey Report / Refer to checklist 1680-CHK-R15-001
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Expansion: provide at all points where kerbs and gutters abut structures. Provide preformed joint filler complying with RMS 3204 within joint.
○ Isolation: provide between pit and rigid pavement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Constructed in fixed forms or by extrusion or slip forming.
3.7 - Kerb & Gutter with Rigid Pavement Constructed Adjacent to Concrete Base

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Kerb & gutter alongside and tied to base placed by fixed forms or slip forming. Longitudinal joints continuous over full length without steps or offsets. Must not deviate from a 3m straight- edge by > 20mm. Joint corrugated and tied as on Drawings and as specified for the base.
○ Kerb & gutter alongside but not tied to the base constructed in fixed forms, extrusion or slip forming. Seal longitudinal joints as on Drawings.
○ Provide kerbs placed on top of concrete base with ties as shown on Drawings.
3.8 - Kerb & Gutter with Rigid Pavement Placed After Concrete Base
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Complete base joint sealing prior to kerb & gutter construction.
○ For kerb & gutter alongside base, extend sealant down vertical face of transverse base joints and any underlying crack > 1mm wide.
3.9 - Kerb & Gutter with Rigid Pavement Constructed Before Concrete Base
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - For kerb/gutter constructed before base and kerb and gutter lip is to be level with upper base surface: radius of lip adjacent to the base < 5mm, unless otherwise on Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Untied joints in base must continue across kerb & gutter in same type and on same alignment.
○ Tied joints need not continue into kerb. Seal joints with sealant used for base joints.
3.11 - Kerb Constructed on Top of Concrete Base
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Align each joint in kerb with underlying base joint.
3.12 - Kerb & Gutter with Rigid Pavement Placed Alongside Base Joints
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Where kerb and gutter is placed alongside the base joints in the kerb and gutter must intersect at the common longitudinal joint (± 15mm).
○ For kerb and gutter placed integrally with the base, align joints with those in base. Otherwise, align joints at an angle of 90° ± 5° to line of kerb.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Kerbs, gutters and vehicular crossings removed and excavations backfilled as per G40 Clause 2.5.
○ Material from removed kerb & gutter will become Daracon property and must be removed and disposed off-site in accordance with the Waste Management Sub-Plan RMS G36
3.14 - No Fines Concrete Under Kerb & Gutter
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Place no fines concrete under kerb and gutter in accordance with RMS 3222 & geotextile comply with RMS R63

○ Cure no fines concrete for 7 days with polyethylene sheeting ≥ 0.125mm thick or until covered by kerb and gutter. Place kerb & gutter after 5 days of placing concrete or until no fines concrete has sufficient strength. Surface voids to remain open, do not slurry surface.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Where shown on the Drawings, construct kerb & gutter in accordance with the Hills Shire Council specification SD14.
4.1 - Identification and Control of Non-conforming Products or Services
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - NCR to be opened & closed prior to closing of construction Lot
4.2 - Verification that Rectified Work Conforms HOLD POINT
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Verification that rectified works conform to accepted rectification method and specifications within the NCR
FREQUENCY - Prior to covering up the works
4.3 - Final Verification of Construction Lot Records
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - To confirm that all inspections and tests have been carried out to completely verify conformity.
FREQUENCY - Prior to closing out each lot
